definition: lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to know/to be aware
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
surname Xie
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to transport under guard

sentences.english: I learned to read carefully, and not to be satisfied with a superficial undersanding of a book.
sentences.chinese: 要認真閱讀，不滿足於表面的一知半解。

sentences.english: Better know nothing than half-know many things !
sentences.chinese: 對許多事情一知半解還不如什麼也不知道。

sentences.english: I have only a scanty knowledge of world affairs.
sentences.chinese: 我對於國際事務只是一知半解。

sentences.english: The violin passed into the arms of a wealthy dilettante.
sentences.chinese: 那把小提琴落到了一個對音樂一知半解的有錢人手裏。

sentences.english: A language must not be too complex, lest the programmer forget half of it.
sentences.chinese: 語言不能太複雜，否則程序員總是會一知半解。

sentences.english: This was an uninformed article and sophomoric in its treatment of the specific technologies.
sentences.chinese: 這是一篇無知的文章，在某些技術問題上一知半解。
我對計算機只是一知半解。

sentences.english: Asked the seller, in fact, they are ill-understood.
sentences.chinese: 問賣主，其實，他們也是一知半解的。

definition: slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
to know that it is so but not why it is so (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 ran2 er2 bu4 zhi1 qi2 suo3 yi3 ran2
related.word: 知其然而不知其所以然

definition: to not fully understand/to only partly understand
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
slight knowledge of sth/to know very little about a subject/a smattering
layman
amidst the clouds and mist/(fig.) mystified/puzzled
shallow/superficial
to not really understand/to half-understand
confused/ignorant
gossip/hearsay/rumor
plain/clear/obvious
layman/amateur
unable to make sense of what one is looking at
to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth
